Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p.201, 15. Name, Archelaos. D. Manacorda and S. Pallecchi, Le fornace romane di Giancola (Bari, 2012) 306-7, A1. From the same die as British Museum 1925,0119.691.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1303)
